newsitem.title: USA: Chrysler Q3 international sales up 19 pct.
newsitem.headline: Chrysler Q3 international sales up 19 pct.

text.p: Chrysler Corp said its international retail vehicle sales rose 19 percent in the third quarter of 1996, to 57,209 cars and trucks from 48,207 units a year earlier.
Chrysler said in Europe, it sold 28,079 vehicles in the July-September period, up 28 percent from the 21,918 vehicles it sold in the third quarter of 1995.

The automaker is now receiving full production of its new- generation minivans from its Eurostar joint-venture plant Graz, Austria, plant, where it builds the Chrysler Voyager and the Jeep Grand Cherokee. Steyer-Daimler-Puch AG also is a partner in the plant.
